titleStmt.title: A sermon preached to the Honorable citizens of London, September 29. 1659. being the day of the election of their Lord Major. Wherein is distinctly shewed, I. The usefulness of a powerful ministry to the civil governor. II. Integrity when in conflict is most amiable and in its highest glory. III. What virtues are desireable in a good magistrate. By Philip Nye a servant of Jesus Christ in his gospel.
titleStmt.author: Nye, Philip, 1596?-1672.

titleStmt.title: A sermon preached to the Honorable citizens of London, September 29. 1659. being the day of the election of their Lord Major. Wherein is distinctly shewed, I. By Philip Nye a servant of Jesus Christ in his gospel.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Peter Cole and Edward Cole printers and book-sellers, at the Printing-press in Cornhil, neer the Royal Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Thomason copy bound with items from 1660.
